title: How to Create a City or Town on Your Computer

steps.headline: On your desktop,right-click and select new,new folder,and name it the name of your city.
steps.description: (Some examples are Lynx Town, Cloud City, etc.)

steps.headline: Inside it, make another folder.

steps.headline: Use the other residents, or even yourself, to build stuff, such as homes to sell, or a store, or even a research center.
steps.description: Get a job and make money. If someone needs something like a textbook or a folder, or if someone moves in and decides to buy a house, whoever they bought that from gets the money, and also pays his employees. Don't forget, play everyone's emotions and personalities, for example, if you make someone not pay an employee, that person's probably going to quit their job.

steps.headline: Use more than just the basics, be creative, for example, don't just sell textbooks, name them, that way you're selling notebooks, checkbooks, journals, etc...
Research is one of the most important things.
steps.description: For example, I found Windows Movie Maker, and, after a while, I researched it, and being creative, made a Movie Studio, and eventually a TV Station, and TV's themselves. Soon everyone had a TV. 3 others and I were large directors, made a lot of movies, and a TV series. Easy way to become rich, [P.S. something like a windows movie maker probably shouldn't be cheap.]

steps.headline: Finally, be creative, use the resources you have, all of them, but read the warnings before going on your own city.

text:
On your desktop,right-click and select new,new folder,and name it the name of your city. (Some examples are Lynx Town, Cloud City, etc.) Inside it, make another folder. Call it 'City Hall,' 'Town Meeting Hall,' 'White House,' etc. Inside that, create a 'Main Office. '{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/a/af/Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/aid211873-v4-728px-Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":348,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"551","licensing":"

"} Make some more folders in that and call them whatever you deem appropriate. They represent the items important to the town and various tasks that are fulfilled in the center building of the town, such as 'Record Book' or 'Secretary's Office.' In the 'Main Office,' create a Word document or text file; this will be used to keep the city's checkbook. Create a folder (NOT inside the City Hall) and give it a residential neighborhood address. This is your house. If you wish, you could be the mayor, or just a regular citizen. Create more houses for more people, but focus on the person representing you. He/she doesn't need to have your name, but if not, make sure you remember which person you are. Two ways to create people are: Make a folder with their name so that you can show what they are "holding," much like an inventory. You can also change the icon of the folder with downloaded sprites or pictures of people so that they can have identities. If you need to turn pictures into icons, you can download an icon-making program. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/e/e1/Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/aid211873-v4-728px-Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":337,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"534","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make a Word document or textbook file and keep track of what they own, their jobs, relationships, what they think, etc. on it. Now give everyone a checkbook. If your people are represented by folders, use a Word or textbook document and create a starting amount of money somewhere around $100,000 for each person. If you have Word or textbook documents for your people, just type a bold heading 'Checkbook' or 'Money' and keep track of that. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a7/Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/a/a7/Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/aid211873-v4-728px-Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":286,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"453","licensing":"

"} Build different rooms in your house, as well as everyone else's house. Everything you build will subtract from that person's amount so give everything a price and TAKE NOTES. To do this, make a Word or textbook document outside the City Hall and call it 'Notes.' Take EVERYTHING down here, including prices, history, and any ideas you suddenly get for the future. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/c/c2/Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/aid211873-v4-728px-Create-a-City-or-Town-on-Your-Computer-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"547","licensing":"

"} Use the other residents, or even yourself, to build stuff, such as homes to sell, or a store, or even a research center. Get a job and make money. If someone needs something like a textbook or a folder, or if someone moves in and decides to buy a house, whoever they bought that from gets the money, and also pays his employees. Don't forget, play everyone's emotions and personalities, for example, if you make someone not pay an employee, that person's probably going to quit their job. Use more than just the basics, be creative, for example, don't just sell textbooks, name them, that way you're selling notebooks, checkbooks, journals, etc... Research is one of the most important things. For example, I found Windows Movie Maker, and, after a while, I researched it, and being creative, made a Movie Studio, and eventually a TV Station, and TV's themselves. Soon everyone had a TV. 3 others and I were large directors, made a lot of movies, and a TV series. Easy way to become rich, [P.S. something like a windows movie maker probably shouldn't be cheap.] Finally, be creative, use the resources you have, all of them, but read the warnings before going on your own city.

Inside that, create a 'Main Office.

They represent the items important to the town and various tasks that are fulfilled in the center building of the town, such as 'Record Book' or 'Secretary's Office.'
In the 'Main Office,' create a Word document or text file; this will be used to keep the city's checkbook.
Create a folder (NOT inside the City Hall) and give it a residential neighborhood  address.
This is your house.
If you wish, you could be the mayor, or just a regular citizen.
Create more houses for more people, but focus on the person representing you.
He/she doesn't need to have your name, but if not, make sure you remember which person you are.

Two ways to create people are:
Make a folder with their name so that you can show what they are "holding," much like an inventory.
You can also change the icon of the folder with downloaded sprites or pictures of people so that they can have identities.
If you need to turn pictures into icons, you can download an icon-making program.

If your people are represented by folders, use a Word or textbook document and create a starting amount of money somewhere around $100,000 for each person.
If you have Word or textbook documents for your people, just type a bold heading 'Checkbook' or 'Money' and keep track of that.

Get a job and make money.
If someone needs something like a textbook or a folder, or if someone moves in and decides to buy a house, whoever they bought that from gets the money, and also pays his employees.
Don't forget, play everyone's emotions and personalities, for example, if you make someone not pay an employee, that person's probably going to quit their job.
